html:
9.22.19  9:19 pm   9.21.19  1:36 pm

hmm. I think if god had to be created, than he wouldn't be god. The question "who created god" assumes that god had to be created. I think he would have to be outside of creation.

I don't think god is stuck in time, space, and matter, like we are.

Humans created computers but they are not bound by the rules that the computers are bound by, like ram, gb storage,etc. Humans are not stuck in the computer. They're outside of the computers. But even humans flaws. A god would be flawless.

The concept of a "god" is so difficult to even wrap around our head.

And if you do find out there is a god, the next question is, which one's the right one?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201909211336

9.21.19  1:36 pm   If god created everything who created god?

      everything

html:
9.20.19  8:27 pm   on 9.20.19  10:28 am   you answered, in part: "literally anyone put on stage more than 10 times will become comfortable there"

this is just not at all true, and can give false hope. I speak from many years of experience, both myself and observed in others.

maybe you mean something different than what you answered here??


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201909201028

9.20.19  10:28 am   9.19.19  8:38 am so, people can't really learn from others when it comes to shows?

      it's a phenomenon that can really only be learned by being there. you can learn a little bit from being in the audience, but it's largely a completely unique phenomenon to be on stage, with nothing else quite being able to truly prepare you for it. but the good news is, it will be as easy to learn as riding a bike once you get on it. literally anyone put on stage more than 10 times will become comfortable there

9.11.19  2:01 pm   I have a lot of things that I want to do, but sometimes (ok most of the time) I get confused and end up off track & increasingly unhappy. It would help to outline the things that I want to do so I know where I am going. Unfortunately, outlining the things that I want to do is not one of the things I want to do, and I can't seem to make myself do it. Is there another way I can keep myself on track?

     you might be forgetting that 'outlining' can be in any format you want. actually i don't know why it should be called an outline ..... how about just writing down all the things? also you can write down all your thoughts about everything, starting with the most confusing thoughts. the more confused, the better

      Also, this is unrelated, but how do I get my youngest sibling to stop making "yo mama" jokes to me? He's roasting himself...

      ah, that's genius

html:
9.5.19  2:01 am   9.4.19  2:05 am really? i guess i'm naive cuz i thought usually when you are watching a professional live concert recording you are hearing what actually happened at the concert. i don't doubt that some people re-record certain bits but everyone?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201909040205

9.4.19  2:05 am   I guess you would have to decide this for yourself but if you were recording a live show to produce and sell on the internet, but then you found out that the drum mics were picking up the vocals, other instruments or audience or just basically, there was too much audio bleeding in all the mics, which made it difficult to mix, add effects, compress, etc. You don't have the luxury of having a controlled environment in a live situation.

Would you then re-record the parts? Or would you leave it as is?

Some people would call re-recording, cheating. I don't know if I would call it that.

      everyone does it
original_html: 9.5.19  2:01 am   9.4.19  2:05 am really? i guess i'm naive cuz i thought usually when you are watching a professional live concert recording you are hearing what actually happened at the concert. i don't doubt that some people re-record certain bits but everyone?

html:
9.3.19  7:02 pm   11.16.18  4:09 pm , did this end up happening


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201811161609

11.16.18  4:09 pm   Why can't you have a strumming guitar?

     i can, but recording a guitar would break a boundary that i have thus far never broken. it's not that i couldn't break it, but i have always been vastly able to accomplish everything i've needed without breaking that boundary. it's kind of like when you are writing essays for school and you are typing all of them. you are typing and typing and typing and typing and typing, and then you want some different fonts so you change the font and that's cool and good. and then you get to a part where you might actually need to write it on paper with an actual quill and ink. you may have a quill in the closet and you think it works and you think you know how to use it maybe .... but do you have paper? maybe/maybe not ... but they sell paper at the store and you think you could probably get the paper .... but what will really happen if you put the quill on to that paper? will there be any unexpected twists and challenges? also you have to get the image back into the computer somehow. ... and you might have a scanner but you are not sure if it works ... and then you will have to make sure it is integrated into your digital work in a way that feels right and makes sense. But you have never gotten around to think about any of this because you have learned to get absolutely everything done by using fonts in innovative ways. so as i said it's an entirely different door which i have avoided opening for a long time, and many people used to lecture me in the past about how i could never succeed without opening that door. but i never listened to them and i never opened the door, because i have always felt that i have had huge advantages otherwise. but i am now for the first time actually considering doing it. i only started considering this about 3 days ago but i'm really starting to think it might be a good idea. getting really sick of that fake banjo
original_html: 9.3.19  7:02 pm   11.16.18  4:09 pm , did this end up happening

answers_original.html:

     i can, but recording a guitar would break a boundary that i have thus far never broken. it's not that i couldn't break it, but i have always been vastly able to accomplish everything i've needed without breaking that boundary. it's kind of like when you are writing essays for school and you are typing all of them. you are typing and typing and typing and typing and typing, and then you want some different fonts so you change the font and that's cool and good. and then you get to a part where you might actually need to write it on paper with an actual quill and ink. you may have a quill in the closet and you think it works and you think you know how to use it maybe .... but do you have paper? maybe/maybe not ... but they sell paper at the store and you think you could probably get the paper .... but what will really happen if you put the quill on to that paper? will there be any unexpected twists and challenges? also you have to get the image back into the computer somehow. ... and you might have a scanner but you are not sure if it works ... and then you will have to make sure it is integrated into your digital work in a way that feels right and makes sense. But you have never gotten around to think about any of this because you have learned to get absolutely everything done by using fonts in innovative ways. so as i said it's an entirely different door which i have avoided opening for a long time, and many people used to lecture me in the past about how i could never succeed without opening that door. but i never listened to them and i never opened the door, because i have always felt that i have had huge advantages otherwise. but i am now for the first time actually considering doing it. i only started considering this about 3 days ago but i'm really starting to think it might be a good idea. getting really sick of that fake banjo
